docs.lead_paragraph: A Colorado woman who police say admitted cutting a fetus from a pregnant stranger she lured with an online ad for baby clothes was bound over for trial by a judge after a preliminary hearing on Tuesday, the Boulder Daily Camera newspaper reported.

headline.main: Colorado Woman Who Stole Fetus Bound Over for Trial
headline.print_headline: Colorado Woman Who Stole Fetus Bound Over for Trial

docs.snippet: A Colorado woman who police say admitted cutting a fetus from a pregnant stranger she lured with an online ad for baby clothes was bound over for trial by a judge after a preliminary hearing on Tuesday, the Boulder Daily Camera newspaper reported.

docs.lead_paragraph: A judge has determined that a woman charged with cutting an unborn baby from a stranger's womb will stand trial.

headline.main: Woman Accused of Cutting Baby From Womb Will Stand Trial
headline.print_headline: Woman Accused of Cutting Baby From Womb Will Stand Trial

docs.snippet: A judge has determined that a woman charged with cutting an unborn baby from a stranger's womb will stand trial.

headline.main: A Mother’s Day Gift That Benefits More Women Than Just Mom

docs.abstract: Eu’Genia Shea creates luxurious moisturizers — and provides above-average wages and job training to its all-female Ghanaian worker cooperatives.
docs.snippet: Eu’Genia Shea creates luxurious moisturizers — and provides above-average wages and job training to its all-female Ghanaian worker cooperatives.

docs.abstract: A number of new apps offer medical consults with doctors via a smart phone, and some of them even make house calls.
docs.snippet: A number of new apps offer medical consults with doctors via a smart phone, and some of them even make house calls.

headline.main: Ashley and JaQuavis Coleman: Kiss Kiss Bang Bang

docs.abstract: Urban fiction, or street lit, has been snubbed by the publishing industry and scorned by black intellectuals. Yet these authors may just be the most successful literary couple in America.
docs.snippet: Urban fiction, or street lit, has been snubbed by the publishing industry and scorned by black intellectuals. Yet these authors may just be the most successful literary couple in America.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Associated Press has documented that half of Ohio's abortion providers have either closed or reduced services over the last four years as the number of abortion procedures is also falling.

headline.main: Ohio Clinics Close, Abortions Decline Amid Restrictions
headline.print_headline: Ohio Clinics Close, Abortions Decline Amid Restrictions

docs.snippet: The Associated Press has documented that half of Ohio's abortion providers have either closed or reduced services over the last four years as the number of abortion procedures is also falling.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Geller Law Group is determined to show that parents can nurture their professional ambitions while being fully present in their children’s lives.

headline.main: A Woman-Led Law Firm That Lets Partners Be Parents
headline.print_headline: A Law Firm That Lets Partners Be Parents

docs.abstract: Geller Law Group has found success while pursuing its founding goal of allowing partners to be fully engaged as parents; six-woman firm aims to demonstrate that women lawyers can truly 'have it all' in a field that has often penalized them for becoming mothers; mere 16.5 percent of law partners in 2013 were women, despite graduating from law school in roughly equal numbers with men.
docs.snippet: The Geller Law Group is determined to show that parents can nurture their professional ambitions while being fully present in their children’s lives.

docs.lead_paragraph: The city’s birthrate is steadily declining, but not among the affluent, and that rise is changing the feel of the city.

headline.main: Baby Boom Among New York’s Affluent

docs.abstract: Ginia Bellafante Big City column notes that birthrate in New York City has been on steady decline, hitting lowest level since Great Depression, but not in wealthy neighborhoods; observes TriBeCa logged one of highest birthrates in city in 2013; suggests drop among working- and middle-class families in city may be due to cost of child-rearing in age of such heightened expectations, particularly for education.
docs.snippet: The city’s birthrate is steadily declining, but not among the affluent, and that rise is changing the feel of the city.
